final_answer.precision_note: Limiting precision is 3 significant figures (from 0.150). Answer given to 3 significant figures.

method: Calculate moles of NaOH using c = n/V (L15): moles = 0.150 mol dm-3 * (23.40/1000) dm3 = 0.00351 mol. Using the stoichiometry from L40 (H2SO4 + 2NaOH), the ratio is 1:2. Moles of H2SO4 = 0.00351 / 2 = 0.001755 mol. Calculate concentration of H2SO4: c = n/V = 0.001755 mol / (25.00/1000) dm3 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
